channel.title: Multiple client selection
channel.description: It would be so much easier to auto with multiple client select. You could multilog auto and get tons more money(or whatever your doing). please comment on the idea, pros cons.

item.title: Multiple client selection
item.dc:creator: @MuNkY MuNkY
item.description:
@MuNkY wrote:

i made a script like this -

[CENTER]Multiple Scar Auto miner

this script uses 2 scar windows and 2 scar windows which both share the same mouse, so it does differ to the new ubi bot. Before i go on i would like to explain that this script is in its BETA and will be improved with the help of testers and reports. Alot mroe cna be done with the fucntions ive used and i hope to take full advantage of them as soon as you post feedback. ALOT of hard work went into this script please dont unappreciate it as i can remove it at anytime and cease updating.

[CENTER]Preparation for autoing[/CENTER]

You will need to open two scar windows
then open one official runescape window
know visit my world switcher and open another window HERE

It is vital that you DO NOT open two official runescape windows but one official and one from my site.

Your screen should know look something like this -

NOTE - remember to open the “sender” script first and the “receiver” script after to allow you to start and stop the sender with ctrl+alt+r and ctrl+alt+s.

Your scar windows should look a bit like this -

Know you have completed this simply enter the data needed (usernames and pass and rock types) then click play on the receiver miner, do not worry about it doing anything because it will only do so once the sender has completed its first mining attempt.

Know bring the official runescape client to the front and press ctrl+alt+run

The reports will be something like this -

scar 1

Successfully compiled Connection Successfully established Secondary checks confirm connection Scar client Located RuneScape game Screen found by size W=766 H=504 Mining Attempt Completion from Scar #1 at :03:46:13 pm Preparing for client switch

scar 2

Connection synchronized Successfully Data flow working correctly Connection sent and received at :03:46:13 pm Mining attempt :0 Started from scar #2 at :03:46:13 pm Mining Status / Status :Classification of mining end received Connection sent and received at :03:46:13 pm Mining attempt :0 Started from scar #2 at :03:46:13 pm Mining Status / Status : complete found scar RuneScape game Screen found by size W =766 H =504 Finished Mining from scar #2 at :03:46:24 pm Message from Scar #1 ready for mining

The script should set up, get the rock colors then switch clients do the same and mine in a loop. I hope you appreciate the ammount of work that i have put into these scripts and give me feedback to improve them. And please cech out my site or forums for antisipated updates and news - HERE

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple client selection
item.dc:creator: @cruel cruel
item.description:
@cruel wrote:

No. It’s single window selection.
You can switch between windows… but you can’t auto on both at the same time.

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple client selection
item.dc:creator: @redragonje65 redragonje65
item.description:
@redragonje65 wrote:

I was looking through the SCAR procedures/functions thing (help menu) to look for something i could use and i came across this.

procedure SetClientWindowHandle(H: Integer); - Set active client window to handle H.
Example:
H:= GetClientWindowHandle;
//specify another client window
FindWindow(‘Debug Image’);
…
//return to previous client
SetClientWindowHandle(H);

Multiple client selection?

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple client selection
item.dc:creator: @cruel cruel
item.description:
@cruel wrote:

Welp… mostly just injecting code to redirect calls to BitBlt [and such] that SCAR calls before its functions. Just injects at runtime so that no one has to patch anything.
That way, itstead of getting the actual contents of the window, it searches whatever I wish.

I had to do that after failing with the SetTargetBitmap or w/e…
It worked technically, but it relied on constant refreshing (which I had a function to set the refresh interval). For for time sensitive operations (like many randoms), this would be bad since it’d require high refresh rates thus making it overkill for the portions of the script that didn’t need it.
So just having it refresh when SCAR made the API calls makes it easier.
However, I don’t think it works perfectly… not to mention it’s useless on RS without a good mouse clicking routine.

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple client selection
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

cruel:

That required actual editing of SCAR.exe itself… but luckily I got the plugin to do that bit at runtime.

Wow, someone else daring to mod SCAR itself…care to elaborate?

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple client selection
item.dc:creator: @cruel cruel
item.description:
@cruel wrote:

Yeah, RS is a resource whore. So you can usually not handle more than a few instances.

This is my offscreen drawing plugin I made a while ago, but never felt like finishing:

Not only good for getting pixels off covered windows, but also can modify the pixels before they’re checked by SCAR. That required actual editing of SCAR.exe itself… but luckily I got the plugin to do that bit at runtime.
As you can see in the screenshot, it modifys the client to 4-bit color before SCAR searches it. (such things can be good for tolerances)
And it draws the client to the debug window on a loop. That can be used for monitoring all instances you’re autoing on… in case of error. And could be edited to be similar to my RS client preview thumbnails:

http://client.cruels.net/images/screen9.PNG

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple client selection
item.dc:creator: @cruel cruel
item.description:
@cruel wrote:

Because you can get banned if you send typing or mouse clicks to the client when the window is not in focus. Because that is not normally possible… and the applet can easily monitor focus events. That’s the major prob.
That’s why impsoft made UBI. But you can technically make a better multi auto method is you can either trick windows into thinking they have focus… or actually forcing multiple windows to have focus at the same time.
I know how to get Windows to give multiple focus, but it has problems that I don’t know how to solve. So I can’t help with that yet.

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple client selection
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

Your screen would like to be 600x800, and instead of just selecting the runescape window, you’d have to select the hole screen, so it would know where to scroll the mouse, it would have to know the location (x,y) on the screen, so wouldn’t it be kinda difficult to make it scroll down to the coords, and, figure out what the coords are.

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple client selection
item.dc:creator: @Morgoth Morgoth
item.description:
@Morgoth wrote:

Well, if you have big res, like 1600x1200 or more, you can have 4-9 RS clients visible for SCAR. The biggest problem is the mouse pointer. It would be stupid (and very detectable) to make single pointer to jump crazily from client to client…).
Another solution for multiple clients with SCAR is to use VMWare for emulating as many virtual computers on your computer as you can fit in your RAM. The con is - VMWare is not a freeware.

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple client selection

item.description:
@LaBo wrote:

Wow, nice to hear Cruel.

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple client selection
item.dc:creator: @cruel cruel
item.description:
@cruel wrote:

Yeah, but would be too hard to have multiple window selection and script managing. Best to just use multiple instance of SCAR to control the autoing of each window.
The only difficult part though it figuring out how to process event in the back ground. You’d need to make a better “silently clicking” method than the one SCAR has. Not to mention you’d have to get SCAR to retrieve colors from window in the background… but I already have that done in an old plugin I made. So now I’d just need to make mouse events.

Read full topic
